title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
hello
820 3476 no dammage liquid
I dont have PP3V42_G3H on this board.
r7020 16.6v

i have short on u7090 pin 2
resistance pin 2 u7090 42.6 [COLOR=#545454][FONT=arial]Ω[/FONT][/COLOR]

Can u guys try help me figure out?

Thank you

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
Voltage on pin 6 and Pin 8 on U7090.

Diodemode reading on L7095.

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
pin 6 and Pin 8 on [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/a1-lt3470a.html"]U7090[/URL].   =   14.31v
Diodemode reading on L7095. = .027v

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
So its not a dead short. I doubt injecting 3V into this rail will find the fault, but you could try as a LAST resort. Its time to examine the board for corrosion,

Was this liquid damage ?

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
board for corrosion on r7095, c7094 and l7095
no dammage liquid .
When i inject 3.4volt on pin 2 l7095 = smc burn

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: Well that's shitty luck then. You'll need a donor SMC.

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: First solve the issue why the SMC fried, check the 3V42 regulator for corrosion.

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
ahh good news, where is 3v42 regulator ?

thanks

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: Realy?? What do you think is U7090??

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: The SMC is dead, it died for a reason. First fix the reason why it died, then replace the SMC.

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H

pin8 14.61v

l7095
pin1 3.44v

f7140 12.34v

smc reset l 3.35v

why i still have a short circuit on pin2 u7090?
still no green light

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: You have 3.46V on pin 2 of U7090....how can there be a short?

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H

why he beep ?

diode mode in both directions

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message:
You are probably and simply still having a partial short somewhere on the line.
While you were replacing u7090 and smc (after removing old chip and before putting new one) did the short went away?
Is the new esmc still burning?

title: 820 3476 no green light no PP3V42_G3H
message: SMC is shorted, replace it with one from identical donor board.
